thread.title: Kevin Durant injures knee against Wizards, set for MRI on Wednesday
thread.title_full: Kevin Durant injures knee against Wizards, set for MRI on Wednesday

author: Whitney Medworth
title: Kevin Durant injures knee against Wizards, set for MRI on Wednesday
text:
Durant asked to be taken out of the game after Zaza Pachulia accidentally backed into his leg.
Kevin Durant suffered a hyperextended left knee in the first minute of Tuesday’s nights game against the Wizards according to the Warriors . He’ll undergo an MRI on Wednesday and will not return to the game. It is unclear at this time how much time, if any, he will miss.
Durant was asked to be taken out of the game after Zaza Pachulia accidentally backed into his leg while fighting for a rebound with Marcin Gortat. You can see the play here which happened in the first minute of the game. Durant tried to play through the next couple of minutes but eventually headed back to the locker room.
KD doesn't look good after this weird injury. Limped next few possessions. Left game. pic.twitter.com/zov4iK0amx 
— Russillo (@ryenarussillo) March 1, 2017 On the way back to the locker room, you can see Durant was visibly in pain.
Kevin Durant heading back to the locker room, holding left knee pic.twitter.com/l6zsUxY5Ky 
— Anthony Slater (@anthonyVslater) March 1, 2017 It’s possible that Durant could miss an extended period of time as the Warriors will probably also be extremely cautious with his return. The Warriors have already clinched a playoff spot and do not need to rush him back at this point.
